intro: Arundastrum benthamianum, commonly known as the Benthams' rush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant typically grows in wet or swampy environments, thriving in moist soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Arundastrum benthamianum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline conditions.
